intro: Solanum expedunculatum, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters, featuring small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Solanum expedunculatum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
